items.sentence: Tom has the same kind of computer that Mary does.
I don't think changing that would be a good idea.
I don't think that I need to tell you what to do.
Tom has been late for work three times this week.
Your things are in one of those boxes over there.
Tom is one of the most popular boys in our class.
I consider my driving skills to be above average.
What color are the last pair of shoes you bought?
Tom and Mary have written several books together.
The smell didn't seem to bother Tom in the least.
The police have their reasons for suspecting Tom.
Neither Tom nor Mary has trouble speaking French.
Neither Tom nor Mary has to do anything else now.
Neither Tom nor Mary has been very busy recently.
Neither Tom nor Mary has been sick for very long.
Neither Tom nor Mary has been here for very long.
Tom is a new student. Mary is a new student, too.
Tom was the one who told me he wanted to do that.
Things just haven't been the same since you left.
I forgot to mail the letter you asked me to mail.
